exercise.label: proteus-rectangular-field
exercise.p: Suppose you are building a fence around a rectangular field, and the field needs to have an area of 9000 square meters. There are many different shapes of rectangles you could consider.

li.p: One option you have considered is to make the field be a square. Draw a picture of what the field would look like in this case.

Another option you have considered is to make the field more like the shape of a piece of notebook paper. Draw a picture of what the field would look like in this case; remember, it still needs to have an area of 9000 square meters.
Draw at least one more picture of a rectangular field that is a different shape than what youâ€™ve drawn before and would still have an area of 9000 square meters.
Which measurements of your three fields are different? Which measurements of your three fields are the same?
Choose letters to represent the key measurements of the field. What are the lowest and highest values of those measurements?
